intro: Protium bolivianum, commonly known as the Bolivian copal tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. Its sap is used in traditional medicine and for making incense. The tree plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
